Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Broad Street in Historic Downtown Charleston. A block from East Bay Street

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The entire second floor of The Peopleâ€™s Building at 18 Broad Street is for sale.  The second floor (actually the third floor since there is a mezzanine) is a beautiful Class A office space.  The space is four individual units that are all under one ownership and offered for sale for a total of 6,354 SF.
The floor is currently set up as two suites. The front portion has a reception area, 10 private offices, open work space, 2 conference rooms, copy/print room, and breakroom/kitchen. The rear space has a reception area, breakroom, two private offices and a large conference room. The entire floor can be available to occupy upon closing. Huge windows, lots of light, beautiful views.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Excellent location on East Bay Street within walking distance to numerous amenities and just minutes from the Arthur Ravenel Bridge.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Historic Building on East Bay Street just below the corner of Calhoun Street available for sale.  The building has been two suites - one on the first floor and one on the upper floors.  The property includes 12 on-site parking spaces. The first floor contains 1080 SF the second and third floors contain 1192 SF each and the fourth floor contains 450 SF.  Excellent location within walking distance to numerous amenities and just minutes from the Arthur Ravenel Bridge. The seller has out grown the space so it is vacant and ready for a new owner occupant or for tenants to move in.  Great opportunity to own and occupy space with on-site parking in Downtown Charleston.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Historic Building on East Bay Street in excellent location

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: This amazing property has undergone a full renovation including structural, plumbing, electrical, mechanical and certainly esthetics! There is a small courtyard and parking area that accompany this ~1,750 sf building. Situated on one of the main intersections on the Charleston Peninsula, 343 E Bay is currently used as 3 offices, conference, kitchen, half bath downstairs and full bath upstairs and even storage space. It could also be an excellent live/work opportunity and double as a small downtown pied-aterre.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Fully Renovated Office Building for Sale

Common.SpaceDescription.Common.Text:
This 2 and 1/2 story wood framed structure was
constructed in the 1920s. The roof is covered with
metal standing seam panels and metal gutters are
attached at the eaves. It has central heating and
air conditioning.

First Floor | 850 SF | Currently Leased

Second Floor | 1,187 SF | 3 Bedrooms | 1 Bathroom

This 2 story office building was constructed in the
1970s. A new roof was installed in 2015. It is
currently 50% leased and offers 9 off-street parking
spaces.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
47 & 49 Calhoun Street is located on one of the busiest corners in Downtown
Charleston. As part of the Charleston Historic District, it is just steps away from
countless shops, restaurants, and businesses. Being on the corner of Calhoun and
East Bay street offers excellent visibility along with heavy foot traffic.
